metadata.title: CVE-2019-9444 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
In the Android kernel in sync debug fs driver there is a kernel pointerleak due to the usage of printf with %p. This could lead to localinformation disclosure with system execution privileges needed. Userinteraction is not needed for exploitation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9444` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-e500mc - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-emb - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1030-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1013-azure - 4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1014-gcp - 4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1007-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.2.0-1013.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-16.19').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1013.19').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1020.23').
